result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Jamar Brown

records.addlTxt: Stipulation for Destruction of Original Exhibits - Jury Trial; received and filed.
Exhibit List - Jury Trial; received and filed.
Stipulation - Bail Jumping (Exhibit 4); received and filed.
Stipulation - Felony Conviction (Exhibit 3); received and filed.
-received and filed.
-received and filed.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. 
At the hour of 3:44pm, Jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in VERDICTS, which were then read in open Court. 

"We, the Jury, find the Defendant, JERRY BROWN, GUILTY of FIRST DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, as charged in Count 1 of the Information."  
Did the Defendant commit such crime while using a dangerous weapon? YES.

"We, the Jury, find the Defendant, JERRY BROWN, GUILTY of FIRST DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, as charged in Count 2 of the Information."  
Did the Defendant commit such crime while using a dangerous weapon? YES.

"We, the Jury, find the Defendant, JERRY BROWN, GUILTY of STALKING, as charged in Count 3 of the Information."  

"We, the Jury, find the Defendant, JERRY BROWN, GUILTY of FELON IN POSSESSION OF A FIREARM, as charged in Count 4 of the Information."  

"We, the Jury, find the Defendant, JERRY BROWN, GUILTY of BAIL JUMPING, as charged in Count 5 of the Information."  

Court polled and discharged the Jury. 

At the hour of 3:52pm, Jury is dismissed for the day.

Regarding Count 1:  For reasons stated on the record, Court STRUCK (AMENDED) COUNT 1 TO REMOVE PENALTY ENHANCER: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Sec. 968.075(1)(a)4. 

Court GRANTED State's Motion for Judgment on the Verdict. Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion for Judgment Not Withstanding the Verdict. 
Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored.

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

**PM SESSION**
Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record regarding updated Jury Instruction. 
Jury in the Box: 1:52pm. 
Court read updated Jury Instruction. 
Closing Statements; State followed by Defense, and State's Rebuttal. 
Court charged the Jury. 
Alternate Jurors selected by lot and released. 
At the hour of 2:54pm, Jury retired to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Jimenez and Sheriff Deputy Lower, who were duly sworn for that purpose. 
JURY DELIBERATION AND SEQUESTRATION. 
Discussion placed on the record regarding what, if any, Exhibits will go back to the Jury.

**AM SESSION**
Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of issues in the jail with Claude J. / Keep Separate Order. Trial proceeded.
Jury in the Box: 9:29am.
Sworn for the State: Officer Joshua Schwechel, Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department.
Sidebar held.
Sworn for the State: Detective Raena Vrtochnick, Milwaukee Police Department.
Jury out of the Box: 10:11am.
Discussion placed on the record regarding Defense hearsay objection.
Jury in the Box: 10:30am.
Sworn for the State: Officer Levour Dawson, Milwaukee Police Department.
Sworn for the State: Detective Martinese McDaniel, Milwaukee Police Department. 
Exhibit 3 and 4; received. 
State rested subject to Rebuttal. 
Jury out of the Box: 10:47am. 
Sidebar placed on the record. 
Defense Motion to Dismiss, argued and denied or granted by the Court.
Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court found the Defendant knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily WAIVED his right to testify.
Jury Instruction Conference and preparation of Verdict forms. 
Jury in the Box: 11:25am.
Defense rested. 
EVIDENCE AND TESTIMONY CLOSED.
Court instructed the Jury. 
At the hour of 11:50am, Jury is released for lunch and ordered to return at 1:45pm. 
Court addressed Stipulations. Court held colloquy with Defendant regarding same. 
Case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial, Branch 46.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial. At the hour of 4:18 PM jury back in box. Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state: Claude J. (in custody witness).  Exhibits 1 and 2 received.  
At the hour of 4:48 PM jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:45 AM on November 2, 2022, Branch 46.
Side bar discussions placed on the record. 
Case adjourned, Branch 46.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. 
Trial proceeded. 

Jury in the Box: 1:56pm.
Opening Statements; State followed by Defense. 
Sworn for the State: Tiffany N.
Sidebar held. 
Exhibit 1; received. 
Jury out of the Box: 2:53pm. 
Court took short break.

Jury in the Box: 3:13pm. 
Previously Sworn and Under Oath for the State: Tiffany N. 
Sidebar held. 
Jury out of the Box: 3:54pm.
Court took short break. 
Discussion placed on the record regarding criminal convictions for Claude J. 
**CLERK CHANGE**

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Jury Selection proceeded. 
Jury in the Box: 10:34am. 
Voir Dire proceeded.  
Conference held in chambers to address Motions to Strike for Cause. 
Peremptory Strikes by the parties.   
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as Jurors in the above entitled cause were selected.
Jury out of the Box: 11:16am. 
Court took short break.
Jury in the Box: 11:28am. 
Jurors were duly impaneled and sworn.
Court instructed the Jury. 
At the hour of 11:54am, Jury is dismissed for lunch and ordered to return at 1:45pm.
Case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial, Branch 46.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 

Jury Panel in Court at 9:18 am.
Voir Dire proceeded.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:26 am.  Court takes short break.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. 
Jury Panel in Court at 3:06pm.  Clerk administered Oath to Jury Panel.
For reasons stated on the record, Court did not start Voir Dire. 
At the hour of 3:23pm, Jury is dismissed for lunch or the day and ordered to return at 8:45am on November 1, 2022. 
Case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial, Branch 46. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Conference held in chambers regarding potential scheduling issues. Defendant's appearance waived for first call. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude appeared by video for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State did not extend an offer to Defendant. placed offer on the record. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court advised the parties that Mr. Brown's case is the number one trial on October 31, 2022. Court ordered case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in Court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion hearing/ Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Defense no longer requested to address Motion Challenging Count 3. Case remains in trial posture; however, parties requested a new Final PreTrial date. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Expires November 10, 2022

Defense has NOT received discovery material or an offer from the State. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions (excluding the Motion Challenging Count 3) are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Motion hearing/Final PreTrial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Motion hearing/Final PreTrial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in Court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Arraignment and Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State previously filed an Information. Defense waived reading of the Information. AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 4, and 5: Defense entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. AS TO COUNT 3: Defense challenged, and requested a Motion hearing date. 
Court set the following deadlines: Defense Motion due on or before September 16, 2022. State Response due on or before September 30, 2022. Bail/Bond hearing and Scheduling Conference proceeded.
KEEP SEPARATE ORDER; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided copy to MCSO.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in Court, Defendant in custody. Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

HELD OFF THE RECORD. 
Case in Court for Arraignment. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defense is not available for today's hearing. Defendant was erroneously transported to CJF and not produced via Zoom for today's hearing. 
Case adjourned for Arraignment and Bail/Bond hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Arraignment and Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court by video with Attorney Michael Jude who appears in person.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective G. Fraley. Court took judicial notice of 19CF5064 and 17CF3714. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment and to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Jude is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

-received and filed.

-received and filed.

No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CLJ; TSN.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
